intro: Cordylanthus mollis subsp. hispidus, commonly known as the hairy leaf curlweed, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats like woodlands and streambanks. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological features compared to other Cordylanthus species.
